resource.chars:
by Dr. Chree relative to experience of 
the Sachenhagen magnetogram. As far 
as my memory serves it was a perfectly 
proper remark which I took to refer to 
the fact that this instrument was 
delivered from Berlin at so late a date 
that Mr. Bernacchi had to bring it out 
by mail steamer.
I havent seen the Times review yet but 
I imagine that the reviewer has placed 
his own interpretation on Dr. Chree’s
Comment.
The following passage from the Review is 
quoted to me:-
“In reviewing the meteorological observations 
of the Discovery a few months ago we had 
occasion to express regret that the observers 
set out on this important expedition with
little or no preliminary training. To what 
was said it is only necessary to add that 
the observations in the present volume 
suffered in the same way “
There seems little doubt that an attack
on the expedition has been made to serve a private 
End but of course I cannot give a proper 
opinion until I have seen the Magnetic Volume 
With apologies for again troubling you 
Yours sincerely 
R. Scott
